title: Outreach doesn't have to be confrontational and don't forget that it's okay not to focus on the animals. Use whatever works to get people thinking!

author: The_Ebb_and_Flow
title: Impressions Matter: Promoting Veganism on a Personal Basis. Advocates shouldn't be phony pushovers, but we also need to recognize the difficulty of making a lifestyle switch, and spread our messages thoughtfully — Faunalytics

author: The_Ebb_and_Flow
title: Most meat eaters support veganism as ‘ethical’ and good for the environment: A new survey finds support for veganism among meat eaters, but suggests most think it is inconvenient, expensive and a sacrifice in terms of taste.

title: Top Tips for Effective Vegan Advocacy — Tobias Leenaert [pdf]

author: The_Ebb_and_Flow
title: Animal Advocates & COVID-19: Resources to Help You Weather the Storm. In the wake of COVID-19, the animal protection movement is experiencing unprecedented challenges and potential opportunities to enact positive change for animals — Faunalytics

author: curiouspika
title: Caregiving is Activism: When we think about the billions of animals exploited by humans, it can be hard to consider the individual. While we fight for legislative protections for animals or encourage others to give up animal products, it’s easy to lose focus on individual suffering animals.

title: Why Animal Rights Activists Must Stand Up for Black Lives- amazing read of an article published by PETA written by a Black vegan activist

author: curiouspika
title: EU citizens! The European Commission has called on citizens and organisations to take part in an online consultation to gather information and views on the EU Animal Welfare Strategy. You have until June 15th to repsond. (More in comments.)

author: Inasaba
title: Something a little different, but extremely important to activists of all kinds. The right to encryption is under threat in the US, which would cripple activists' ability to communicate securely. Please use this site to contact your representatives and help prevent this dystopian bill from passing!

author: curiouspika
title: Many people mistakenly think that wool is not cruel "because the sheep don't die" for the wool. We know this is not true. Please consider sharing this article on your social media and with friends and family that may not know the 'big picture' on wool.
